tickerNews.title: BUMI Plans to Eliminate US$2.35 Billion Accumulated Deficit
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources announced on Tuesday (23/4) a plan to carry out a quasi-reorganization using the consolidated financial statements dated 31 December 2023. The quasi-reorganization is an accounting procedure to restructure equity by eliminating a negative retained earnings balance. Through this corporate action, BUMI will eliminate its accumulated deficit of US$2.35 billion as of 2023. In exchange, additional paid-in capital of US$2.05 billion will be reduced to a negative US$298.69 million. Net equity will not change. Management explained that the benefits of the quasi-reorganization include: providing a true picture of the company's financial condition without the burden of past deficits; allowing dividend distribution because there will be no deficit balance; and facilitating easier access to financing for business development. BUMI last paid a dividend in 2012. Under Law No. 40 of 2007, dividends can only be paid when retained earnings are positive. Other issuers that have performed quasi-reorganizations include Garuda Indonesia in 2013 and Solusi Bangun Indonesia in 2010. The potential to resume dividend payments could increase BUMI’s attractiveness to investors, although its dividend-paying capacity is not as strong as coal producers such as ADRO, ITMG and PTBA, which have stronger cash positions. Based on 2023 financials, BUMI had cash of US$76.8 million, debt of US$306.6 million and equity of US$2.77 billion, giving a net debt-to-equity ratio of 0.08x. Operationally, BUMI recorded operating profit of US$56.8 million with interest expense of US$22.5 million, resulting in net profit of US$10.9 million. On Tuesday (23/4) the market responded positively, with BUMI shares rising 21.18% to IDR 103 per share.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Net Profit 1Q24 +11.7% YoY; Loan Growth +17.1% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia reported net profit of IDR 12.9 trillion for 1Q24, up 5.4% quarter-on-quarter and 11.7% year-on-year, slightly below consensus as it reached only 24% of the FY24 consensus estimate. The result was driven by Net Interest Income, which rose to IDR 19.8 trillion (+2% QoQ, +7% YoY), leading Pre-Provision Operating Profit to increase to IDR 16.9 trillion (+9.4% QoQ, +8.5% YoY). Provisions for 1Q24 were IDR 1 trillion (up from zero in 4Q23, -30% YoY). On the operational side, loan disbursements grew 17.1% YoY, surpassing management guidance of 8-10% growth, while the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio rose to 71.2% (2023: 70.2%).

tickerNews.title: PANI Plans Third Rights Issue in 3Q24
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg Technoz reported that Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI) plans a third rights issue in 3Q24. According to an anonymous source cited by Bloomberg Technoz, PANI is targeting funds similar to the second rights issue in 2023, around IDR 10 trillion. Company Secretary Christy Grassela said the company has not confirmed the rumor but affirmed that the company will continue developing the PIK 2 area.

tickerNews.title: HMSP Announces 2023 Dividend of Approximately IDR 8.1 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna will distribute a 2023 dividend of about IDR 8.1 trillion, or approximately IDR 69.3 per share. The dividend is payable cum on the regular market and negotiations on 2 May 2024, with payment on 17 May 2024. Based on HMSP’s closing price on Tuesday (23/4) of IDR 855 per share, the implied dividend yield is 8.1%.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors Reports Komatsu Equipment Sales Decline in March 2024
tickerNews.content: United Tractors recorded sales of Komatsu heavy equipment amounting to 301 units in March 2024, down 2% month-on-month and 46.2% year-on-year. For 1Q24, Komatsu sales fell 37.1% YoY to 1,126 units, with market share decreasing to 29% (2023: 32%). In the mining contractor segment, UNTR produced 32.3 million tons of coal (+21% YoY) in 1Q24, with overburden removal of 286.3 million cubic meters (+16.8% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa Reports 7.1% YoY Cement Sales Volume Growth in March 2024
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa reported a 7.1% year-on-year increase in cement sales volume for March 2024, raising its total market share to 29.5% (March 2023: 27.7%) while national cement sales fell 0.9% YoY. Volume growth was driven by Java Island, where sales rose 13.4% YoY and market share increased to 38.4% (Feb 2023: 33.2%). Outside Java, sales fell 2.6% YoY and market share dropped to 19.0% (March 2023: 19.8%).

tickerNews.title: ESSA Industries Indonesia Reports Net Profit of US$10.2 Million in 1Q24
tickerNews.content: ESSA Industries Indonesia posted a net profit of US$10.2 million in 1Q24, down 59% quarter-on-quarter but up 228% year-on-year, representing 17% of the FY24 consensus estimate. Revenue fell to US$73.8 million (-34% QoQ, -16% YoY), while cost of goods sold declined more sharply (-19% QoQ, -33% YoY) due to lower manufacturing costs (-17% QoQ, -48% YoY). Consequently, net profit margin improved to 13.8% (1Q23: 3.5%).

tickerNews.title: Djarum Group Rumored to Acquire Shares of Surya Semesta Internusa
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that the Djarum group plans to acquire shares of Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA). However, an anonymous source at Kontan said details such as transaction value and seller are unknown. PT Djarum declined to comment, while SSIA’s VP Head of Investor Relations Erlin Budiman said no announcement has been made by the company.

tickerNews.title: MPMX Plans Expansion into Battery Repair and Electricity Services
tickerNews.content: Mitra Pinasthika Mustika (MPMX) plans to expand its business into battery and electric accumulator repair, electricity sales, and other electricity-related activities. The expansion aims to broaden the segment offering electric products. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary general shareholders meeting on 29 May 2024.

tickerNews.title: Delta Dunia Makmur Approves Treasury Share Reduction and Share Buyback
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Delta Dunia Makmur (DOID) approved a capital reduction by repurchasing 422.4 million (4.9%) treasury shares. After the transaction, DOID’s outstanding shares will be 8.2 billion. Shareholders also approved a share buyback program of up to 819.9 million (10%) shares.

tickerNews.title: ADMF Records New Financing Growth of +3% YoY in 1Q24
tickerNews.content: Adira Dinamika Multi Finance (ADMF) reported new financing growth of 3% year-on-year, reaching IDR 11 trillion in 1Q24. ADMF targets new financing growth of 10-12% for 2024. As of March 2023, the Non-Performing Financing (NPF) ratio stood at 2%.

tickerNews.title: BSML Plans Rights Issue Up to 400 Million New Shares
tickerNews.content: Bintang Samudera Mandiri Lines (BSML) plans a rights issue of up to 400 million new shares with a ratio of 46.255.625:10.000.000, resulting in a dilution of up to 17.8%. The subscription price will be between IDR 250 and IDR 300 per share, potentially raising IDR 103.2-120 billion. Funds will be used to purchase one tugboat and one barge, partially repay debt to Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and for working capital. The main shareholder and ultimate beneficial owner, PT Goldfive Investment Capital and Nengah Rama Gautama, will transfer all rights to public investors. The rights will be cum on the regular market and negotiations on 28 June 2024.
